components.description:
A shrine used for the Japanese Shinto religion. This emoji generally displays the torii, which is the gate to the Shinto Shrine. The torii is generally a red colored structure, with a curved roof section above two posts.

This icon is used on maps in Japan to represent the location of a Shinto Shrine, similar to how the hot springs emoji is the icon used on Japanese maps to show the location of an onsen.
components.title: Shinto Shrine

This icon is used on maps in Japan to represent the location of a Shinto Shrine, similar to how the hot springs emoji is the icon used on Japanese maps to show the location of an onsen.
title: Shinto Shrine

version.description:
Unicode 5.2 pre-dated emoji inclusion in Unicode by one year, and included many characters primarily sourced from the ARIB set of Japanese broadcasting symbols.

The following characters were among those added to Unicode in 2009, several of which were given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols -> Map symbol from ARIB STD B24
emoji_net_data.definition: A shrine used for the Japanese Shinto religion. This emoji generally displays the torii, which is the gate to the Shinto Shrine. The torii i http://emojipedia.org/shinto-shrine/
emoji_net_data.name: shinto shrine

bn:00110550a: Relating to or characteristic of Shintoism

bn:00071355n: A shrine is a holy or sacred place, which is dedicated to a specific deity, ancestor, hero, martyr, saint, daemon or similar figure of awe and respect, at which they are venerated or worshipped.
A holy place dedicated to a specific figure of respect.
A holy or sacred place dedicated to a specific deity, ancestor, hero, martyr, saint, or similar figure of awe and respect, at which said figure is venerated or worshipped.
A place of worship hallowed by association with some sacred thing or person
Originally a container, especially for a relic and often a cult image, and/or a holy or sacred place containing the same.
Holy or sacred place, which is dedicated to a specific deity

bn:00076465n: A temple is a structure reserved for religious or spiritual activities, such as prayer and sacrifice, or analogous rites.
Structure reserved for religious or spiritual activities
Place of worship consisting of an edifice for the worship of a deity

bn:00071101n: Formerly the state religion of Japan, a type of animism involving the worship of ancestors and nature spirits.
The ancient indigenous religion of Japan lacking formal dogma; characterized by a veneration of nature spirits and of ancestors
Shinto, also kami-no-michi, is the indigenous religion of Japan and the people of Japan.

apple_vendor_description: Apple’s shinto shrine emoji is rendered with meticulous detail, presenting a vibrant vermillion structure with a gently curved, dark roof, characteristic of traditional Japanese architecture. On Apple devices, the glossy 3D shading and soft lighting bring the miniature temple to life, evoking a sense of peace, spirituality, and cultural significance. It’s often used to signify travel to Japan, a connection to nature, or a moment of reflection and reverence in digital conversations.
